title: De Gaulle: force of character
creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
brief_description: Part of the “Leaders of the 20th century: portraits of power” series, this episode shows how Charles De Gaulle, through his determination and force of character, was able to provide a focal point for the Free French during the occupation years in France. Incorporates footage of De Gaulle in England and North Africa during the war years. Narrated by Henry Fonda.
